page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Until recently the Shirley area,like most areas in the West Midlands,had a record of mainly full employment,to a large extent in manufacturing industries.A survey carried out of representative families showed that the depression of the early 1980s had had a profound effect on employment in the area.There was a male unemployment rate of 10%,and a female rate of only 6%,the difference probably being accounted for by the number of mothers taking part-time jobs such as school cleaners.Of those in employment only one person was employed in primary industry (a gardener),whereas 32% were employed in secondary industry and 66% in tertiary industry.Over the last 5 years there had been a movement of 17% of workers from secondary to tertiary industry,a clear sign of the decline in manufacturing industry in the area.
